label: 法華寺
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hokkeji (J.) 法華寺, also referred to as 氷室御所 Himuro gosho. Nunnery established in Nara by the government in 741as the representative 法華滅罪之寺 Hokke metsuzai no tera nunnery of the kokubunji system in the capital province of Yamato, through the efforts of the empress 光明 Kōmyō. Although the temple was expanded early on, it fell into decline by the Kamakura era;  however, through the efforts of the Shingon-Ritsu monk 叡尊 Eison, it was reconstructed as a sub-temple of Saidaiji.
